Razor Storm.name: Razor Storm
Razor Storm.sourceRef: Manual of the Planes, Dragon Magazine 419
Razor Storm.fullText:
Bladeling Racial Attack Razor Storm

Spikes and blades leap from your body to tear through your foes.

Encounter
Minor Action      Close burst 1

Targets: Each creature in the burst

Attack: Strength, Constitution, or Dexterity vs. Reflex.
You gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.
    Level 11: The bonus increases to +4.
    Level 21: The bonus increases to +6.

Hit: 1d6 + Strength modifier, Constitution modifier, or Dexterity modifier damage.
    Level 11: 2d6 + Strength modifier, Constitution modifier, or Dexterity modifier damage.
    Level 21: 3d6 + Strength modifier, Constitution modifier, or Dexterity modifier damage.


Published in Manual of the Planes, page(s) 117, Dragon Magazine 419.
Razor Storm.flavor: Spikes and blades leap from your body to tear through your foes.
keywords:
Close burst 1

Targets: Each creature in the burst

Attack: Strength, Constitution, or Dexterity vs. Reflex.

Strength, Constitution, or Dexterity vs. Reflex.
You gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.
    Level 11: The bonus increases to +4.
    Level 21: The bonus increases to +6.

1d6 + Strength modifier, Constitution modifier, or Dexterity modifier damage.

    Level 21: 3d6 + Strength modifier, Constitution modifier, or Dexterity modifier damage.

Rending Spines.name: Rending Spines
Rending Spines.fullText:
Bladeling Racial Utility 2Rending Spines

Your body spines lengthen to rake and tear any creature that attacks you.

Daily      Stance
Minor Action      Personal

Effect: You assume the rending spines stance. Until the stance ends, the following effects apply.
         You are slowed.
         You take a -2 penalty to all defenses.
         Any creature adjacent to you that hits or misses you with a melee attack takes damage equal to 3 + one-half your level.


Published in Dragon Magazine 419.
Rending Spines.flavor: Your body spines lengthen to rake and tear any creature that attacks you.
Rending Spines.effect:
You assume the rending spines stance. Until the stance ends, the following effects apply.

         Any creature adjacent to you that hits or misses you with a melee attack takes damage equal to 3 + one-half your level.

Gouging Blade.name: Gouging Blade
Gouging Blade.fullText:
Bladeling Racial Utility 6Gouging Blade

A jagged spike sprouts from the back of your hand. Each time you strike in melee, the barb delivers a grisly injury.

Daily
Minor Action      Personal

Effect: Until the end of the encounter, when you hit a creature adjacent to you with a melee attack, that creature takes 1d6 extra damage.


Published in Dragon Magazine 419.
Gouging Blade.flavor: A jagged spike sprouts from the back of your hand. Each time you strike in melee, the barb delivers a grisly injury.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: Until the end of the encounter, when you hit a creature adjacent to you with a melee attack, that creature takes 1d6 extra damage.
Gouging Blade.effect: Until the end of the encounter, when you hit a creature adjacent to you with a melee attack, that creature takes 1d6 extra damage.

Improvised Portal.name: Improvised Portal
Improvised Portal.fullText:
Bladeling Racial Utility 10Improvised Portal

You scribble a glyph on a door and add a mental push so it opens to someplace it shouldn’t.

Encounter
Minor Action      Melee 1

Target: One door, gate, or similar object

Effect: The target becomes a magical portal to a square within 20 squares of you. The portal lasts until the end of your next turn. Until the effect ends, the target and the square you chose are considered to be adjacent to each other for movement purposes.


Published in Dragon Magazine 419.
Improvised Portal.flavor: You scribble a glyph on a door and add a mental push so it opens to someplace it shouldn’t.

Planar Jaunt.name: Planar Jaunt
Planar Jaunt.fullText:
Bladeling Racial Utility 16Planar Jaunt

Although doing so is painful and exhausting, you can whisk yourself and your companions to a destination you have committed to memory.

Daily      Teleportation
Standard Action      Close burst 5

Requirement: You must use this power at the end of an extended rest.

Target: You and each ally in the burst

Effect: You lose three healing surges. Each target then teleports to a permanent teleportation circle to which you have memorized the sigil sequence.

Special: When you gain this power, you learn the sigil sequences of two permanent teleportation circles in locations determined by the Dungeon Master.


Published in Dragon Magazine 419.
Planar Jaunt.flavor: Although doing so is painful and exhausting, you can whisk yourself and your companions to a destination you have committed to memory.
Planar Jaunt.requirement: You must use this power at the end of an extended rest.

Bred for Battle.name: Bred for Battle
Bred for Battle.fullText:
Bladeling Racial Utility 22Bred for Battle

You cause the blades all over your body to lengthen and tear your foes, while your awareness of nearby danger heightens.

Daily      Stance
Minor Action      Personal

Effect: You assume the bred for battle stance. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
         You gain a +2 power bonus to AC.
         You cannot be marked.
         Your melee weapon attacks that hit deal 2d6 extra damage.
         At the end of each of your turns, you can spend a healing surge and regain no hit points. If you do so, you regain the use of your razor storm power.


Published in Dragon Magazine 419.
Bred for Battle.flavor: You cause the blades all over your body to lengthen and tear your foes, while your awareness of nearby danger heightens.
Bred for Battle.effect:
You assume the bred for battle stance. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
         You gain a +2 power bonus to AC.
         You cannot be marked.
         Your melee weapon attacks that hit deal 2d6 extra damage.
         At the end of each of your turns, you can spend a healing surge and regain no hit points. If you do so, you regain the use of your razor storm power.
